activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan M. Whitney

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Violation Report

11:24 AM Defendant Brendan M. Whitney in court.  Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision Report
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Indigency hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:51 PM Defendant Brendan M. Whitney not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Indigency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:11 PM Defendant Brendan M. Whitney appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Brendan M. Whitney.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1150 Signature bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.K.V. or her children, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. No acts or threats of violence. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Matter to be set for Indigency hearing.
